text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Prisoner who committed suicide in Albacete had not been a (Basque separatist) ETA member for three years
- Arafat and Levy restart peace process thanks to EU mediation
- Stock market rises 2.65 percent, its biggest climb in three years
- Vigil in Peru supporting television chain which denounced phone tapping
EL MUNDO
- Basque government "understands" those who vote for (Basque separatists) Herri Batasuna and (United Left's) Anguita excuses them
- FIFA says Ronaldo is right in face of Barcelona wishes
- Clinton threatens trade war if EU vetoes Boeing -McDonnell merger
DIARIO 16
- Anguita levitates; United Left lifts political blockage of HB and ETA
ABC
- (Basque Nationalist Party) PNV, (Socialists) PSOE and (governing) Popular Party remove authorisation from councillors in Arrigorriaga town hall for voting with HB
CINCO DIAS
- Stock markets, bullish again
- Cable business sets off in Spain
- Ice-cream sector emigrates because of bad weather
EXPANSION
- Germany prepares ground to flexibilise monetary union
- BCH relaunches deal with Endesa, will take three percent and enter core shareholder group
- Stock market sees biggest one-day rise in three years
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Stock market sets year's biggest rise, but uncertainty remains
- Euphoria in Wall Street as fears of immediate rate hike disappear
- Aldeasa to sell 70 percent of share capital in last week of September
- BCH earns 22.6 percent more and consolidates recovery
- (Catalan coalition Convergence and Unity) conditions its support of budget to health deal
--Madrid newsroom + 34 1 585 8340
